description.long: `c` must be either an ordinary cell, or an exotic cell. If cell is exotic, it is automatically loaded to yield an ordinary cell `c'` and converted into a _Slice_ afterwards.

description.short: Removes a _Slice_ `s` from the stack. Throws an exception if it is not empty.

instructions.comment: Remove the empty slice from the stack
Try to remove a non-empty slice

description.long: Loads a cell reference `c` from `s`.
Loads a cell reference `c` from `s`, converts it to _Slice_ and returns the _Slice_ and remainder.
Returns the first `0 <= length <= 1023` bits of `s`.
Returns all but the first `0 <= length <= 1023` bits of `s`.
Returns the last `0 <= length <= 1023` bits of `s`.
Returns all but the last `0 <= length <= 1023` bits of `s`.
Returns `0 <= l' <= 1023` bits of `s` starting from offset `0 <= length <= 1023`, thus extracting a bit substring out of the data of `s`.
Returns the first `0 <= length <= 1023` bits and first `0 <= refs <= 4` references of `s`.
Returns all but the first `length` bits of `s` and `refs` references of `s`.
Returns the last `0 <= length <= 1023` data bits and last `0 <= refs <= 4` references of `s`.
Returns all but the last `length` bits of `s` and `refs` references of `s`.
Returns `0 <= l' <= 1023` bits and `0 <= r' <= 4` references from _Slice_ `s`, after skipping the first `0 <= length <= 1023` bits and first `0 <= r <= 4` references.
Splits the first `0 <= length <= 1023` data bits and first `0 <= r <= 4` references from `s` into `s'`, returning the remainder of `s` as `s''`.

Splits the first `0 <= length <= 1023` data bits and first `0 <= r <= 4` references from `s` into `s'`, returning the remainder of `s` as `s''`. This is a quiet version of `SPLIT` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Transforms an ordinary or exotic cell into a _Slice_, as if it were an ordinary cell. A flag is returned indicating whether `c` is exotic. If that be the case, its type can later be deserialized from the first eight bits of `s`.
Loads an exotic cell `c` and returns an ordinary cell `c'`. If `c` is already ordinary, does nothing. If `c` cannot be loaded, throws an exception.
Loads an exotic cell `c` and returns an ordinary cell `c'`. If `c` is already ordinary, does nothing. If `c` cannot be loaded, returns 0.
Checks whether there are at least `length` data bits in _Slice_ `s`. If this is not the case, throws a cell deserialisation (i.e., cell underflow) exception.
Checks whether there are at least `r` references in _Slice_ `s`.
Checks whether there are at least `length` data bits and `r` references in _Slice_ `s`.
Checks whether there are at least `length` data bits in _Slice_ `s`.
Checks whether there are at least `r` references in _Slice_ `s`.
Checks whether there are at least `length` data bits and `r` references in _Slice_ `s`.
Returns the `n`-th cell reference of _Slice_ `s` for `0 <= n <= 3`.
Returns the number of data bits in _Slice_ `s`.
Returns the number of references in _Slice_ `s`.
Returns both the number of data bits and the number of references in `s`.
Returns the count `n` of leading zero bits in `s`, and removes these bits from `s`.
Returns the count `n` of leading one bits in `s`, and removes these bits from `s`.
Returns the count `n` of leading bits equal to `0 <= x <= 1` in `s`, and removes these bits from `s`.
Returns the depth of _Slice_ `s`. If `s` has no references, then `x == 0`; otherwise `x` is one plus the maximum of depths of cells referred to from `s`.

Returns the depth of _Cell_ `c`. If `c` has no references, then `x == 0`; otherwise `x` is one plus the maximum of depths of cells referred to from `c`. If `c` is a _Null_ instead of a _Cell_, returns zero.
Returns level of the cell.
Returns level mask of the cell.
Returns `i`th hash of the cell.
Returns `i`th depth of the cell.

Loads a `Gram` or `VarUInteger 16` amount from _Slice_ `s`, and returns the amount as _Integer_ `x` along with the remainder `s'` of `s`. The expected serialization of `x` consists of a 4-bit unsigned big-endian integer `l`, followed by an `8l`-bit unsigned big-endian representation of `x`.

Loads a `VarInteger 16` amount from _Slice_ `s`, and returns the amount as _Integer_ `x` along with the remainder `s'` of `s`. The expected serialization of `x` consists of a 4-bit unsigned big-endian integer `l`, followed by an `8l`-bit signed big-endian representation of `x`.

Loads a `VarUInteger 32` amount from _Slice_ `s`, and returns the amount as _Integer_ `x` along with the remainder `s'` of `s`. The expected serialization of `x` consists of a 5-bit unsigned big-endian integer `l`, followed by an `8l`-bit unsigned big-endian representation of `x`.

Loads a `VarInteger 32` amount from _Slice_ `s`, and returns the amount as _Integer_ `x` along with the remainder `s'` of `s`. The expected serialization of `x` consists of a 5-bit unsigned big-endian integer `l`, followed by an `8l`-bit signed big-endian representation of `x`.
Loads a valid `MsgAddress` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes the loaded `addr` value onto the stack along with _Slice_ `s'` with the remaining data.
A quiet version of `LDMSGADDR`: on success, pushes an extra `-1`; on failure, pushes the original `s` and a zero.
Loads a signed `width`-bit (`0 <= width <= 257`) integer `x` from _Slice_ `s`, and returns the remainder of `s` as `s'`.
Loads an unsigned `width`-bit integer `x` from (the first `width` bits of) `s`, with `0 <= width <= 256`.
Preloads a signed `width`-bit integer from _Slice_ `s`, for `0 <= width <= 257`.
Preloads an unsigned `width`-bit integer from `s`, for `0 <= width <= 256`.

Quiet version of `LDIX`: loads a signed `width`-bit integer from `s` similarly to `LDIX`, but returns a success flag, equal to `-1` on success or to `0` on failure (if `s` does not have `width` bits), instead of throwing a cell underflow exception.

Loads an unsigned `width`-bit integer `x` from (the first `width` bits of) `s`, with `0 <= width <= 256`. This is a quiet version of `LDUX` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Preloads a signed `width`-bit integer from _Slice_ `s`, for `0 <= width <= 257`. This is a quiet version of `PLDIX` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Preloads an unsigned `width`-bit integer from `s`, for `0 <= width <= 256`. This is a quiet version of `PLDUX` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.
Loads the first `0 <= width <= 1023` bits from _Slice_ `s` into a separate _Slice_ `loaded`, returning the remainder of `s` as `s'`.
Returns the first `0 <= width <= 1023` bits of `s` as `loaded`.

Loads the first `0 <= width <= 1023` bits from _Slice_ `s` into a separate _Slice_ `loaded`, returning the remainder of `s` as `s'`. This is a quiet version of `LDSLICEX` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Returns the first `0 <= width <= 1023` bits of `s` as `loaded`. This is a quiet version of `PLDSLICEX` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.
Loads a little-endian signed 32-bit integer.
Loads a little-endian unsigned 32-bit integer.
Loads a little-endian signed 64-bit integer.
Loads a little-endian unsigned 64-bit integer.
Preloads a little-endian signed 32-bit integer.
Preloads a little-endian unsigned 32-bit integer.
Preloads a little-endian signed 64-bit integer.
Preloads a little-endian unsigned 64-bit integer.
Quietly loads a little-endian signed 32-bit integer.
Quietly loads a little-endian unsigned 32-bit integer.
Quietly loads a little-endian signed 64-bit integer.
Quietly loads a little-endian unsigned 64-bit integer.
Quietly preloads a little-endian signed 32-bit integer.
Quietly preloads a little-endian unsigned 32-bit integer.
Quietly preloads a little-endian signed 64-bit integer.
Quietly preloads a little-endian unsigned 64-bit integer.
Returns the `n`-th cell reference of _Slice_ `s`, where `0 <= n <= 3`.
Returns `i`th hash of the cell.
Returns `i`th depth of the cell.
Preloads a signed `width`-bit integer from _Slice_ `s`.
Preloads an unsigned `width`-bit integer from `s`.

Loads a signed `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data. This is a quiet version of `LDI` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Loads an unsigned `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data. This is a quiet version of `LDU` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Preloads a signed `width`-bit integer from _Slice_ `s`. This is a quiet version of `PLDI` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Preloads an unsigned `cc+1`-bit integer from `s`. This is a quiet version of `PLDU` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Preloads the first `32(c+1)` bits of _Slice_ `s` into an unsigned integer `x`, for `0 <= c <= 7`. If `s` is shorter than necessary, missing bits are assumed to be zero. This operation is intended to be used along with `IFBITJMP` and similar instructions.
Returns the first `0 < c+1 <= 256` bits of `s` as `loaded`.

Cuts the next `c + 1` bits of `s` into a separate _Slice_ `loaded`. This is a quiet version of `LDSLICE` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Returns the first `0 < c+1 <= 256` bits of `s` as `loaded`. This is a quiet version of `PLDSLICE` which means that instead of throwing an exception, it pushes a status flag to the stack: 0 if the operation fails, -1 if the operation succeeds.

Checks whether `s` begins with (the data bits of) `search`, and removes `search` from `s` on success. On failure throws a cell deserialization exception. Primitive `SDPFXREV` can be considered a quiet version of `SDBEGINSX`.

Checks whether `s` begins with (the data bits of) `search`, and removes `search` from `s` on success. This is a quiet version of `SDBEGINSX` which means it pushes a status flag onto the stack: 0 if `s` does not begin with `search`, -1 if it does.
Checks whether `s` begins with constant bitstring `search` of length `8x+3` (with continuation bit assumed), where `0 <= x <= 127`, and removes `search` from `s` on success.

Checks whether `s` begins with constant bitstring `search` of length `8x+3` (with continuation bit assumed), where `0 <= x <= 127`, and removes `search` from `s` on success. This is a quiet version of `SDBEGINS` which means it pushes a status flag onto the stack: 0 if `s` does not begin with `search`, -1 if it does.

description.short: Loads a signed `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data.

exit_codes.condition: Top element is not an Int.
Second element is not a Slice.

description.long: Loads a signed `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data. This is a longer encoding of `LDI`.

description.short: Loads an unsigned `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data.

exit_codes.condition: Top element is not an Int.
Second element is not a Slice.

description.long: Loads an unsigned `width`-bit integer `x` from _Slice_ `s` and pushes loaded value on stack along with _Slice_ with remainder data. This is a longer encoding of `LDU`.
Cuts the next `c + 1` bits of `s` into a separate _Slice_ `loaded`.
Cuts the next `c + 1` bits of `s` into a separate _Slice_ `loaded`. This is a longer encoding of `LDSLICE`.
